sen.j: 清滝街道（きよたきかいどう）は、大阪府と奈良県・京都府南端部を結ぶ街道のひとつである。
sen.e: The Kiyotaki-kaido Road ("Kiyotaki Kaido" in Japanese) is one of the roads which joins Osaka Prefecture, Nara Prefecture and the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Kiyotaki-kaido Road ("Kiyotaki Kaido" in Japanese) is one of the roads which joins Osaka Prefecture, Nara Prefecture and the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: The Kiyotaki-kaido Road ("Kiyotaki Kaido" in Japanese) is one of the roads which joins Osaka Prefecture, Nara Prefecture and the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: （広義としての）伊勢参宮街道・奈良街道のひとつでもある。
sen.e: It can also be regarded as part of the Nara-kaido Road, which is one of the Ise Shrine pilgrimage roads.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It can also be regarded as part of the Nara-kaido Road, which is one of the Ise-jingu Shrine pilgrimage roads.
It can also be regarded as part of the Nara-kaido Road, which is one of the Ise-jingu Shrine pilgrimage roads.

sen.j: 四條畷市の清滝峠を越えることからその名が付いた。
sen.e: It is called the Kiyotaki-kaido Road because it crosses the Kiyotaki-toge Pass in Shijonawate City.
It is called the Kiyotaki-kaido Road because it crosses the Kiyotaki-toge Pass in Shijonawate City.
It is called the Kiyotaki-kaido Road because it crosses the Kiyotaki-toge Pass in Shijonawate City.

sen.j: 守口市内から門真市を通り、四條畷市中野地区にかけての区間は守口街道と称するが、本頁では一体として取り扱う。
sen.e: Although the part of Kiyotaki-kaido Road which runs from Moriguchi City center, through Kadoma City and up to Nakano district in Shijonawate City, is referred to as the Moriguchi-kaido Road, this section deals with them as one.

Although the part of Kiyotaki-kaido Road which runs from Moriguchi City center, through Kadoma City and up to Nakano district in Shijonawate City, is referred to as the Moriguchi-kaido Road, this section deals with them as one.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: かつて、奈良時代に行基によって開かれた道といわれている。
sen.e: It is believed that the Kiyotaki-kaido Road was opened by Gyoki.
It is believed that the Kiyotaki-kaido Road was opened by Gyoki.
It is believed that the Kiyotaki-kaido Road was opened by Gyoki.

sen.j: 現在の国道163号が踏襲しており、大阪と木津川市方面を結ぶ道路・街道である。
sen.e: The present-day National Route 163 follows the route of Kiyotaki-kaido Road, connecting Osaka and Kizugawa City area.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The present-day National Route 163 follows the route of Kiyotaki-kaido Road, connecting Osaka and Kizugawa City area.
The present-day National Route 163 follows the route of Kiyotaki-kaido Road, connecting Osaka and Kizugawa City area.

sen.j: 斑鳩町龍田までの竜田川沿いの磐船街道と重複する区間も「清滝街道」と称している場合がある。
sen.e: The part of the Iwafune-kaido Road running along the Tatsuta-gawa River at Tatsuta, Ikaruga-cho, is also sometimes referred to as Kiyotaki-kaido Road.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The part of the Iwafune-kaido Road running along the Tatsuta-gawa River at Tatsuta, Ikaruga-cho, is also sometimes referred to as Kiyotaki-kaido Road.
The part of the Iwafune-kaido Road running along the Tatsuta-gawa River at Tatsuta, Ikaruga-cho, is also sometimes referred to as Kiyotaki-kaido Road.

sen.j: 守口街道
sen.e: Moriguchi-kaido Road
Moriguchi-kaido Road
Moriguchi-kaido Road

sen.j: 守口宿で京街道と分岐すると、大和田駅まで京阪本線沿いを通り、巣本交差点の西で国道163号とクロスする。
sen.e: At Moriguchi-shuku the Kyo-kaido Road branches off from the Moriguchi-kaido Road, which then runs alongside Keihan Main Line railway up to Owada Station and crosses National Route 163 to the west of the Sumoto intersection.

At Moriguchi-shuku the Kyo-kaido Road branches off from the Moriguchi-kaido Road, which then runs alongside Keihan Main Line railway up to Owada Station and crosses National Route 163 to the west of the Sumoto intersection.

At Moriguchi-shuku the Kyo-kaido Road branches off from the Moriguchi-kaido Road, which then runs alongside Keihan Main Line railway up to Owada Station and crosses National Route 163 to the west of the Sumoto intersection.

sen.j: 国道の少し南側を通り、蔀屋西交差点で国道163号と合流する。
sen.e: It then runs to the south of the national route, before merging with National Route 163 at the Shitomiyanishi intersection.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It then runs to the south of the national route, before merging with National Route 163 at the Shitomiyanishi intersection.
It then runs to the south of the national route, before merging with National Route 163 at the Shitomiyanishi intersection.

sen.j: 国道170号を通り過ぎるとすぐに蔀屋東交差点で国道から北へ逸れる。
sen.e: Immediately after passing National Route 170, the Moriguchi-kaido Road branches off to the north at the Shitomiyahigasi intersection.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Immediately after passing National Route 170, the Moriguchi-kaido Road branches off to the north at the Shitomiyahigasi intersection.
Immediately after passing National Route 170, the Moriguchi-kaido Road branches off to the north at the Shitomiyahigasi intersection.

sen.j: 清滝川に沿って旧道を進み、そのまま清滝街道へ続く。
sen.e: The Moriguchi-kaido Road, along with the Kiyotaki-gawa River, follows the route of the former road and leads to the Kiyotaki-kaido Road.
The Moriguchi-kaido Road, along with the Kiyotaki-gawa River, follows the route of the former road and leads to the Kiyotaki-kaido Road.
The Moriguchi-kaido Road, along with the Kiyotaki-gawa River, follows the route of the former road and leads to the Kiyotaki-kaido Road.

sen.j: 現在は大阪府道158号守口門真線が道筋をほぼそのまま踏襲している。
sen.e: The route taken by the Moriguchi-kaido Road is almost exactly the same as the present-day Moriguchi Kadoma section of Osaka Prefectural Road 158.
The route taken by the Moriguchi-kaido Road is almost exactly the same as the present-day Moriguchi Kadoma section of Osaka Prefectural Road 158.
The route taken by the Moriguchi-kaido Road is almost exactly the same as the present-day Moriguchi Kadoma section of Osaka Prefectural Road 158.

sen.j: （大阪府誌第4編（明治36年刊）の記述）
sen.e: Description in Osaka Prefectural Magazine Vol. 4 (published in 1903)
Description in Osaka Prefectural Magazine Vol. 4 (published in 1903)
Description in Osaka Prefectural Magazine Vol. 4 (published in 1903)

sen.j: 「北河内郡守口町大字守口にて国道第2号路線（京街道）より分岐し同郡門真村、大和田村、四宮村、寝屋川村等の諸村を聯合す。
sen.e: "The road branches off from National Route 2 (Kyo-kaido Road) at Oaza Moriguchi, Moriguchi-cho, Kitakawachi County and connects Kadoma Village, Owada Village, Shinomiya Village, Neyagawa Village and other villages in Kitakawachi County.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: "The road branches off from National Route 2 (Kyo-kaido Road) at Oaza Moriguchi, Moriguchi-cho, Kitakawachi County and connects Kadoma Village, Owada Village, Shinomiya Village, Neyagawa Village and other villages in Kitakawachi County.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: "The road branches off from National Route 2 (Kyo-kaido Road) at Oaza Moriguchi, Moriguchi-cho, Kitakawachi County and connects Kadoma Village, Owada Village, Shinomiya Village, Neyagawa Village and other villages in Kitakawachi County.

sen.j: 同郡甲可村大字中野に於いて東高野街道に接続せり。
sen.e: It then joins Higashi Koya-kaido Road at Oaza Nakano, Koka Village, Kitakawachi County.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It then joins Higashi Koya-kaido Road at Oaza Nakano, Koka Village, Kitakawachi County.
It then joins Higashi Koya-kaido Road at Oaza Nakano, Koka Village, Kitakawachi County.

sen.j: 延長壹里参拾弐町弐拾五間にして、地勢は始終田圃を貫通せるを以って路面平夷なれども、左右屈折する所多く又低湿の地たるを免れず。」 と記載。
sen.e: The road is about 7.5 km long, has many curves to the left and right, and because it continually passes through rice fields is low and marshy.
The road is about 7.5 km long, has many curves to the left and right, and because it continually passes through rice fields is low and marshy."
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。"補足しました。
sen.e: The road is about 7.5 km long, has many curves to the left and right, and because it continually passes through rice fields is low and marshy."

sen.j: 清滝街道
sen.e: Kiyotaki-kaido Road
Kiyotaki-kaido Road
Kiyotaki-kaido Road

sen.j: 四條畷市役所付近で守口街道からそのまま続き、東高野街道と交差する。
sen.e: The Moriguchi-kaido Road becomes the Kiyotaki-kaido Road around Shijonawate City Hall and then crosses Higashi Koya-kaido Road.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Moriguchi-kaido Road becomes the Kiyotaki-kaido Road around Shijonawate City Hall and then crosses Higashi Koya-kaido Road.
The Moriguchi-kaido Road becomes the Kiyotaki-kaido Road around Shijonawate City Hall and then crosses Higashi Koya-kaido Road.

sen.j: そして清滝峠を越え、北田原地区で「磐船街道」と交差。
sen.e: The Kiyotaki-kaido Road climbs over the Kiyotaki Pass and crosses Iwafune-kaido Road in the Kitatahara district.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Kiyotaki-kaido Road climbs over the Kiyotaki Pass and crosses Iwafune-kaido Road in the Kitatahara district.
The Kiyotaki-kaido Road climbs over the Kiyotaki Pass and crosses Iwafune-kaido Road in the Kitatahara district.

sen.j: 国道と合流したり逸れたりしながら東進し、京都府木津川市で国道24号・奈良街道と合流する。
sen.e: The road continues east, sometimes joining the national route and sometimes veering away from it, merging with the Nara-kaido Road on National Route 24 at Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture.
The road continues east, sometimes joining the national route and sometimes veering away from it, merging with the Nara-kaido Road on National Route 24 at Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture.
The road continues east, sometimes joining the national route and sometimes veering away from it, merging with the Nara-kaido Road on National Route 24 at Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: （大阪府誌第4編の記述）
sen.e: Description published in the Osaka Prefectural Magazine Vol. 4
Description published in the Osaka Prefectural Magazine Vol. 4

sen.j: 下記が記載されている。
sen.e: The following is described.
sen.cmt: 43行目の原文「と記載。」を移動し、「下記が記載されている。」に変更。

sen.j: 「北河内郡甲可村大字南野に於ける東高野街道より起り、田原村大字下田原和河国界に於いて同郡磐船村より来る磐船街道を併はせり。」
sen.e: "The Kiyotaki-kaido Road starts from Higashi Koya-kaido Road in Oaza Minamino, Koka Village, Kitakawachi County and joins Iwafune-kaido Road, which comes from Iwafune Village, Kitakawachi County at the border between Yamato and Kawachi administrative regions in Oaza Shimotawara, Tawara Village.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処和河国界は大和と河内の国界と解釈しました。
sen.e: "The Kiyotaki-kaido Road starts from Higashi Koya-kaido Road in Oaza Minamino, Koka Village, Kitakawachi County and joins Iwafune-kaido Road, which comes from Iwafune Village, Kitakawachi County at the border between Yamato and Kawachi administrative regions in Oaza Shimotawara, Tawara Village.

sen.j: 「奈良県生駒郡龍田町に入りて以って、奈良街道に合せり。」
sen.e: The Kiyotaki-kaido Road then enters Tatsuta-cho, Ikoma County, Nara Prefecture and merges with the Nara-kaido Road.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 「専河内東北部と大和西北部との間の交通に便ぜるものなり。」
sen.e: The road is convenient mainly for the traffic travelling between the northeastern part of Kawachi and the northwestern part of Yamato.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The road is convenient mainly for the traffic travelling between the northeastern part of Kawachi and the northwestern part of Yamato.

sen.j: 「本管内延長一里弐拾七町拾弐間路幅一間五分なり。」
sen.e: The road is about 7 km long and 2.7 m wide.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 「地勢は全部山地より成り、亭々たる老杉路面を掩ふ。」
sen.e: The whole area is mountainous and old tall cedars overhang the road.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The whole area is mountainous and old tall cedars overhang the road.

sen.e: As it heads east, the road becomes steeper.
